message.content:
cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CL 

This paper deals with the problem of recommending tours to travellers, which is a common application of artificial intelligence (AI) and information retrieval (IR) techniques. The authors propose a machine learning approach that uses features derived from both points-of-interest (POI) and routes to recommend a sequence of POIs. This involves learning a POI ranking model and transition patterns between POIs, which can be seen as a form of supervised learning. The paper also proposes a probabilistic model to combine the results of POI ranking and POI-to-POI transitions, which can be seen as a form of probabilistic reasoning. Overall, the paper covers a range of topics that are relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including AI, IR, machine learning (LG), social and information networks (SI), and computational linguistics (CL).
